item.title: A cryptocurrency deal and Broken Tooth - what can go wrong?
item.description:
A cryptocurrency deal and Broken Tooth - what can go wrong?

What legal recourse or compensation would investors have if things turn sour with an offering that is closely related to casino junket operators?

item.title: Ethereum First: Investment Product Opens for Trading on Nasdaq Exchange - CoinDesk
item.description:
Ethereum First: Investment Product Opens for Trading on Nasdaq Exchange - CoinDesk

A first-of-its-kind investment product focused on ethereum is now open to investors on the Nasdaq Stockholm exchange. Announced today, CoinShares, headed by former JPMorgan Chase trader Daniel Masters, is launching an exchange-traded note (ETN) for ether, the cryptocurrency that powers the ethereum blockchain.

item.title: Foreign digital currency exchange fined $110M in US for anti-money laundering law failures
item.description:
Foreign digital currency exchange fined $110M in US for anti-money laundering law failures

For the first time ever, the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (" Fincen"), has asserted jurisdiction in the United States over a foreign digital currency exchange named BTC-E for the purposes of fines,, and assessed civil penalties for anti-money laundering law failures under the Bank Secrecy Act in the amount of $110,003,314.

item.title: RSK and Coinfirm discuss Blockchain, Bitcoin, mass adoption and more
Why and how regulators should embrace ICOs? - Cove Identity - Medium
item.description:
Why and how regulators should embrace ICOs? - Cove Identity - Medium

The history of the financial investing world is full of innovations that created new avenues for opportunity but also encouraged fraud and 'irrational exuberance', forcing authorities and regulators to step in and protect citizens from the dangers of unregulated financial activities.

item.title: What I Look for as an ICO Advisor - Hacker Noon
item.description:
What I Look for as an ICO Advisor - Hacker Noon

No matter who you are, it's hard to decipher between projects that are game-changing and those that are problematic, questionable, and scammy money-grabs. While running the benjaCoin ICO this summer, I was eager to share the experience especially as it related to the topics of governance and regulation.

item.title: Why regulation will only get faster in the ICO space - lessons from the "dot-com" boom and bust.
item.description:
Why regulation will only get faster in the ICO space - lessons from the "dot-com" boom and bust.

James W. Marshall is a name that is embedded in folklore and US history that most of us will never have heard of. The humble carpenter from New Jersey was working in the American River at the base of the Sierra Nevada mountains in Northern California as part of a team working to build a water-powered saw mill for a local entrepreneur, John Sutter.

,

An interesting comparison of Dot-Com vs ICO

item.title: Hedge Funds Flip ICOs, Leaving Other Investors Holding the Bag
item.description:
Hedge Funds Flip ICOs, Leaving Other Investors Holding the Bag

Instead of speculating on bitcoin, the smart money has figured out that one of the surest ways to get rich quickly with cryptocurrencies is to be in early on initial coin offerings. Hedge funds are proving to be first among equals when it comes to digital token sales by technology startups, receiving preferential discounts and terms and then often cashing out.

item.title: Here's The Man Who Created ICOs And This Is The New Token He's Backing
item.description:
Here's The Man Who Created ICOs And This Is The New Token He's Backing

The video begins with a loud, hyper, motorized ticking noise. The camera zooms in, between the backs of some mens' heads, to show a conference panel. The screen gets darker, the camera jolts back and forth, then it shows the backs of chairs, then everything goes blurry ....

item.title: Chinese money dominates bitcoin, now its companies are gunning for blockchain tech
item.description:
Chinese money dominates bitcoin, now its companies are gunning for blockchain tech

Beijing, China It's a sweltering summer night when I'm invited to join a bitcoin miner from Shenzhen at a "bitcoin club" somewhere in downtown Beijing. I've just returned from visiting one of the world's largest bitcoin mines and find myself at a gathering of cryptocurrency enthusiasts at a craft beer brewery in the Sanlitun nightlife district....
